Getting started with webR for Tidy Tuesday

Load the data

Since webr only has limited packages weâ€™ll load the Tidy Tuesday data directly. Click the Run code button at the top to load the data.





Take a look at the data here using your favorite commands (e.g., head(surveys)). Any commands you enter will be run right in the browser.









Note that there is a species code "NA" for Neotoma albigula, so you might want to add na.strings = "" to the read.csv calls (e.g., read.csv("https://tidytuesday.weecology.org/surveys.csv", na.strings = "")). You can change them right in the code block and click Run code to rerun.






Install packages


To install packages in webr use webr::install() with a vector of packages you want to install.


The following packages are currently available in webr:






 [1] "Hmisc"        "MASS"         "Matrix"       "R6"           "RColorBrewer"
